p: The principal habitats for the main vector species of arboviruses, A. aegypti and A. Albopictus, are manmade, containers or water tanks that are used for the storage of rainwater ( Morrison et al., 2004). Some local studies show that there is a relationship between precipitation and the abundance of vectors ( Scott et al., 2000, Romero-Vivas and Falconar, 2005). The increase in humidity favors a habitat for the development of mosquito vectors; floods can cause catastrophic effects on nature by decreasing food sources, as deforestation favors the movement of insects to areas inhabited by humans ( Patz and Kovats, 2002).
